doc.title: Nature Capital: Conservation, Tourism and the Primate's Place
doc.plot: In Costa Rica's Manual Antonio National Park the appeal of vibrant wildlife and luscious jungle have made it a hot spot for tourism and, consequently, a sore spot for conservationists and local naturalists. The exploration of this conflict in Nature Capital; Tourism, Conservation and the Primate's Place force us to reflect upon our own place in nature and to consider the consequences of the co-modification of contact with other species.
